Pre-Game Insights: After a poor start in Euro 2024, Kylian Mbappé and his teammates will be hoping to bounce back against Belgium at 6 pm on Monday, in what is the toughest match of the round of 16.
Didier Deschamps, William Saliba, Ibrahima Konaté, Eduardo Camavinga, Kylian Mbappé: One by one, those who have spoken in recent days have repeated the mantra 'A new competition begins.'
The French team had a disappointing first round with just one win and two goals scored in three games, raising doubts about their ability to go far in the competition.
Deschamps reminded the team of their transformation in the 2018 World Cup after a laborious first round, emphasizing the difference between the early stages and knockout phases.
France's opportunity could arrive in their match against Belgium, a team which also failed to live up to its seeded status, finishing second in its group with a mixed record.
Belgium's captain Kevin De Bruyne had a falling-out with fans after a timid third match, which could bond the team together.
Belgium's starting team is in transition but remains solid with key players like Kevin De Bruyne and Romelu Lukaku, who have been denied three goals since the start of the Euro.
The Belgian team is ideally suited to counter-attacking, which should make France cautious.
Belgium is dreaming of erasing the traumatic defeat at the 2018 World Cup, considered to be an injustice.
